intro: Hexisea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian hexisea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
